macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Hit Record Highs After Weaker Non-Farms Data
items.summary: US equity markets closed at record levels on Friday with the Dow up 0.48% to 49,504, S&P 500 up 0.65% to 6,966, and Nasdaq up 0.81% to 23,671, driven by softer employment data reducing rate cut expectations. Fed rate cut odds for March fell to under 30% amid focus on upcoming inflation data.

items.title: S&P 500 Falls 0.58% to 6926 on Cyclical Sector Weakness
items.summary: The US500 index dropped 0.58% to 6926 points on January 12, weighed down by industrials, materials, and financials, while Nasdaq edged up 0.16% led by Alphabet's 2.5% gain. JOLTS data showed sharp drop in job openings, ADP hiring rebounded modestly, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations.

items.title: US Futures Decline as European Stocks Mixed Ahead of Open
items.summary: S&P 500 futures fell 0.7% and Dow futures 0.5% on January 12 morning, with European Stoxx 600 down 0.2%; Asian markets rose with Hang Seng up 1.4% and Shanghai Composite up 1.1%. US 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.196%, Brent crude dipped to $63.29.

items.title: S&P 500 and Dow Set Historic Highs in Robust Weekly Gains
items.summary: US equities surged last week with S&P 500 up 1.6%, Nasdaq 100 up 2.2%, and Russell 2000 up 4.6% in its best start since 2021; market breadth improved beyond mega-caps. Focus shifts to Q4 earnings and inflation data this week.

items.title: Oil Surges and Gold Hits $4,510 on Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Brent crude jumped 2.18% to $63.34 and WTI 2.35% to $59.12 amid Iran unrest, while gold rose 0.77% to $4,510.15 on haven demand; dollar index up 0.30% to 99.17 as rate cut bets ease.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Holds Above $92K as AI and DePIN Sectors Rally
items.summary: Bitcoin traded firmly above $92,000, up 1.6% in the past 24 hours, while Ethereum gained 2.1% to over $3,150. AI-linked tokens and DePIN outperformed with double-digit gains in FET, TAO, and others amid sector rotation.

items.title: Grayscale Prepares Altcoin ETF Filings for BNB and HYPE
items.summary: Grayscale has registered trusts for BNB and HYPE, signaling institutional interest in altcoins. This move boosts sentiment as retail focuses on AI tokens like 2DAI, which rallied 185% weekly.

items.title: DeepSnitch AI Launches with Hype to Match 2DAI's 185% Weekly Gains
items.summary: DeepSnitch AI presale gains traction with expectations of explosive post-launch growth due to staking supply shock and demand for security tools. Follows 2DAI's massive 185% rally in the past week.

items.title: Major Cryptos Mixed; FXS Surges 29%, REZ and AMP Up 11% and 10%
items.summary: Crypto market shows mixed trading among top coins, with outperformers FXS (+29%), REZ (+11%), and AMP (+10%) leading gains as of January 12, 2026.

items.title: Czech National Bank Purchases $1M in Bitcoin and Digital Assets
items.summary: The Czech National Bank bought $1 million in bitcoin, stablecoins, and tokenized deposits to gain experience with blockchain assets amid diversification from USD reserves.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: iMini AI Launches Precise Edit for Advanced Image Generation
items.summary: iMini AI introduces Precise Edit, a next-generation AI image generator that allows direct editing of specific image areas without full regeneration, improving workflows for creators and marketers.

items.title: BNL Researchers Develop PFITRE for AI-Powered 3D X-ray Tomography
items.summary: Scientists at Brookhaven National Laboratory unveil PFITRE, a novel AI method combining convolutional neural networks with X-ray physics to reconstruct nanoscale 3D images from limited data and angles.

items.title: Microsoft AI Leader Mustafa Suleyman Warns on AI Controllability
items.summary: Mustafa Suleyman, Microsoft AI leader, cautions that distinguishing alignment from true controllability is critical, calling it the 'life-or-death red line' for AI development.

items.title: WTW Radar Announces Integration with Databricks for Data Sharing
items.summary: WTW Radar integrates with Databricks to streamline and accelerate data sharing in AI-driven risk and analytics platforms.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: New Divinity Promises Superior Character Creator to Baldur's Gate 3
items.summary: Developers of the upcoming Divinity game tease an even more detailed character creator with more colors, options, control, and chaos than Baldur's Gate 3, potentially keeping players in the main menu for hours. The announcement highlights enhancements aimed at surpassing Larian's previous work.

items.title: Assassin's Creed Director: Industry Giants Mistake in Hiring Too Many Employees
items.summary: Former Assassin's Creed: Unity director criticizes large studios for overstaffing, arguing the future of gaming belongs to smaller teams following the film industry's model. He highlights this as the biggest mistake by industry giants.

items.title: Larian CEO Reveals Baldur's Gate 3 Blocked from Nintendo Consoles
items.summary: Larian Studios wanted to port Baldur's Gate 3 to Nintendo Switch 2, but the decision was not theirs to make. The CEO notes future projects like Divinity may have better chances on Nintendo platforms.

items.title: Fallout TV Show Season 2 Boosts Game Players by 80% in December
items.summary: The second season of Amazon Prime's Fallout TV series caused an 80% jump in players for Fallout 76 and other Fallout games during December. This surge underscores the impact of media adaptations on game engagement.

items.title: GameStop Closes Multiple Bucks County Stores Amid Nationwide Pullback
items.summary: GameStop shutters four stores in Bucks County and nearby areas, including Quakertown, Richboro, Warminster, and Willow Grove, halving local locations as the retailer shifts from physical stores due to digital sales trends. Remaining stores include Levittown and Fairless Hill.

items.title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon Leads Week 3 Releases
items.summary: Nihon Falcom's latest JRPG, The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon, stands out as the biggest release for January 12-18, 2026, amid a light schedule favoring indie and mid-tier games. The week highlights a trend of quieter early-year launches giving smaller titles visibility.

items.title: Five Overlooked Steam Releases Including Vital Shell and Dungeon Antiqua 2
items.summary: PC Gamer spotlights recent Steam gems like Vital Shell (sci-fi shmup with Vampire Survivors-style leveling, Jan 8), Dungeon Antiqua 2 (8-bit JRPG sequel, Jan 8), and Blood Money: Lethal Eden (Jan 10) amid daily release overload.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Motional Targets 2026 Launch for Las Vegas Driverless Robotaxi Service
items.summary: Autonomous vehicle company Motional announced plans to launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026, marking a major milestone after restructuring and refocusing its operations around AI-driven technology.

items.title: XPENG Achieves Production Milestone and Launches Flagship Model
items.summary: Chinese automaker XPENG announced a critical production milestone and unveiled its next-generation flagship vehicle model as part of its strategic evolution into a global technology leader.

items.title: CES 2026 Showcases Innovative Consumer Gadgets
items.summary: CES 2026 featured numerous unconventional tech products including Honor's Robot Phone with a motorized camera gimbal, Strutt's autonomous personal vehicle, and Tomorrow Doesn't Matter's foldable headphones that convert into a speaker.
